title: Sirtona
excerpt: A bold yet disciplined identity system for a digital-creative agency, balancing premium feel with accessibility.
alt: Sirtona brand identity mockup across digital and print assets.
problem: As a new digital-creative agency, Sirtona needed a strong, cohesive identity that signaled professionalism and creativity, while standing apart from crowded local agency aesthetics.
solution: Craft a modular design system anchored in deep indigo, sharp typographic rhythm, and a flexible grid. Develop assets that adapt across digital, social, and print without losing clarity.
highlights: Premium color system with accessible contrast targets.
Versatile logo variants suitable for small icons to large outdoor media.
Grid-based layout rules for consistency across campaigns.
Interactive brand guideline for team and collaborators.
approach: Treat the brand as both laboratory and showcase - test fast, refine rigorously, and package results into reusable brand modules that embody Sirtona’s promise.

process.title: Discovery
process.body: Mapped the brand vision, values, and target audience to establish tone and positioning.

process.title: Exploration
process.body: Generated multiple design routes exploring typography, color, and motion cues.

process.title: Refinement
process.body: Codified selected direction into logo system, palettes, type scales, and motion tokens.

process.title: Delivery
process.body: Produced a brand kit with templates, brand book, and roll-out strategy.

outcome: A distinct and flexible identity system that became both the face of Sirtona and a portfolio proof of capability for future clients.
deliverables: Templates for social media and print

gallery.alt: Sirtona billboard mockup in urban context

title: Biruh Tutors
excerpt: A bright and trustworthy identity system designed for an online tutoring platform, balancing professionalism with warmth.
alt: Biruh Tutors logo and identity mockup displayed on stationery and digital screens.
problem: The startup had no clear visual direction. Early materials felt generic and failed to capture the supportive, aspirational tone needed to attract students and parents.
solution: Develop a system centered on uplifting colors, approachable typefaces, and a flexible logo mark that signals clarity and trust. Establish rules for digital and print consistency.
highlights: Friendly logo system adaptable to both small screens and large print.
Color palette inspired by light, clarity, and optimism.
Typography chosen for readability across digital learning platforms.
Brand kit enabling fast production of learning materials and ads.
approach: Combine educational motifs with a minimal, modern style. Explore several typographic directions, refine color accessibility, and test adaptability across tutoring use cases.

process.title: Research
process.body: Studied competitors and interviewed parents and tutors to capture the desired tone.

process.title: Exploration
process.body: Sketched logos and experimented with palettes to find a balance between modern and academic.

process.title: Refinement
process.body: Defined final logo, color system, and typography with detailed guidelines.

process.title: Delivery
process.body: Packaged the identity kit with templates for social media, presentations, and certificates.

outcome: A professional yet warm brand identity that strengthened trust with students and parents, improved recognizability, and set the tone for growth in the tutoring market.

gallery.alt: Biruh Tutors brand applications on social media and stationery

title: Sage
excerpt: A sharp and confident identity system for a modern barbershop, blending timeless craft with contemporary style.
alt: Sage barbershop branding applied across signage, grooming products, and digital presence.
problem: The shop had strong service quality but no distinct brand presence. Visual materials were inconsistent and failed to reflect the premium grooming experience they offered.
solution: Develop a bold wordmark, refined iconography, and a monochrome-led palette accented with deep green. Extend the system across signage, packaging, and social media to unify perception.
highlights: Custom logo mark that balances sharpness and sophistication.
Versatile brand system adaptable to both print (signage, cards) and digital (Instagram, website).
Palette and type choices that evoke trust, precision, and modern masculinity.
Brand kit enabling quick production of social campaigns and merchandise.
approach: Blend traditional barbershop cues - scissors, straight razors, geometric patterns - with a minimal, fashion-forward aesthetic. Test the system in situ, from shop signage to social posts.

process.title: Discovery
process.body: Analyzed competitor barber brands and interviewed clients about expectations and lifestyle values.

process.title: Exploration
process.body: Sketched multiple logo directions, tested typefaces and palettes against moodboards.

process.title: Refinement
process.body: Finalized the core mark, color codes, and secondary graphics for packaging and apparel.

process.title: Delivery
process.body: Delivered a complete brand kit with logo system, templates, and signage-ready assets.

outcome: A cohesive identity that elevated Sage’s perception as a stylish, premium grooming destination, attracting a younger and more design-conscious clientele.

title: AWiB Ethiopia
excerpt: Unified social media presence and content design for AWiB Ethiopia, enhancing storytelling across leadership, mentorship, and community.
alt: AWiB Ethiopia social media designs across campaign posts, event promos, and community stories.
problem: AWiB had multiple initiatives (main AWiB brand, Meri, Haset) sharing values but lacking a unified content design strategy. Their posts across campaigns and programs were inconsistent in visual identity, making their stories less cohesive and harder to recognize.
solution: Create a content design system for AWiB’s core brand: consistent templates, color treatments, typographic hierarchy, and imagery style. Ensure adaptability so that Meri and Haset can spin off from the core without losing clarity or brand recognition.
highlights: Cohesive branded template library for campaign, event, testimonial, and announcement posts.
Image treatment to unify photography style, including illustrations or overlays.
Improved visual hierarchy so key messages (dates, calls to action, quotes) stand out.
Streamlined design workflow for AWiB’s communications team-faster deployment across programs.
approach: Audit existing content → define visual pillars (color, typography, imagery) → develop master templates → test variations → deliver the system with style guide for scale from 2023–2025.

process.title: Audit & Discovery
process.body: Reviewed AWiB’s existing content, interviewed communications and program leads, identified where brand was leaking or inconsistent.

process.title: Mood & Visual Exploration
process.body: Built moodboards for imagery, color, and layouts, tested different treatments for quotes, event promos etc.

process.title: Template System Development
process.body: Designed reusable templates across content types (events, leadership stories, calls to action).

process.title: Rollout & Feedback
process.body: Deployed initial designs for AWiB, collected feedback, refined templates; documented guidelines for Meri & Haset to adapt.

outcome: More visually consistent and recognisable social media presence, improved efficiency in content creation, clearer identity across programmes, increased engagement in campaign posts.

title: Meri (AWiB)
excerpt: Visual identity and content design for Meri - a youth, employability, and life-skills focused programme under AWiB.
alt: Meri branding and social media templates for youth and leadership stories.
problem: Meri needed its own voice in visuals: youthful, aspirational, approachable. While aligned under AWiB, its content was often lost in the broader branding, not resonating as strongly with the young female graduate audience.
solution: Crafted a visual identity specific to Meri: color accents, type treatments, photography style and template designs that speak to youth empowerment, skill-building, mentorship, and professional readiness.
highlights: Vibrant color palette and approachable fonts to appeal to young graduates.
Design templates for employability workshops, mentorship sessions, programme announcements.
Imagery and illustration styles showing peer collaboration, learning, and growth.
Consistent brand voice across digital platforms (Instagram, LinkedIn) for visibility.
approach: Survey youth interests and aesthetics → develop moodboards → prototype templates for Meri-specific content → test on social posts and workshop promos → hand over Meri-specific guide + adapt AWiB master templates.

process.title: Audience & Visual Research
process.body: Explored what visual styles young Ethiopian female graduates respond to; reviewed competitor youth programmes.

process.title: Exploration
process.body: Created several visual directions: modern, energetic vs more subdued & professional; chose balance.

process.title: Template System
process.body: Designed feed posts, stories, workshop promos, educational infographics.

process.title: Implementation
process.body: Rolled out across seasons and collected performance feedback to refine colors, layouts.

outcome: Stronger engagement from youth audience, clearer visual differentiation from main AWiB brand, more consistent content production for Meri’s events and promotions.

title: Haset (AWiB)
excerpt: Branding and content design for Haset - AWiB’s women leadership programme, focusing on building leadership capacity, community, and networks.
alt: Haset leadership programme visuals: event posts, club meeting promos, member success stories.
problem: Haset needed visuals that reflect maturity, leadership, and empowerment. Previously, materials were more generic and didn’t fully communicate the programme’s depth and community aspect.
solution: Developed an identity for Haset: strong typographic voice, refined color choices, imagery styles aligned with leadership and growth; design templates for club meeting promos, leadership workshops, and testimonies of members.
highlights: Sophisticated typography and clean layout emphasizing clarity and authority.
Design templates for recurring Haset club meetings, promotional materials, leadership workshop events.
Visual storytelling of progress, community, and impact via member stories.
Balance between formal professionalism and personal warmth in design style.
approach: Map out Haset’s audience values → collect visuals that show leadership and community → test different visual tones (formal, warm, personal) → codify identity; deliver adaptable assets for recurring programming.

process.title: Discovery & Values Mapping
process.body: Interviewed programme leads and participants to understand what leadership means for them; identified visual cues of community, growth, confidence.

process.title: Visual Exploration
process.body: Tried multiple color palettes and typographic hierarchies; picked imagery style that supports authenticity.

process.title: Templates and Storytelling Systems
process.body: Designed templates for meeting announcements, leadership workshops, success stories.

process.title: Rollout & Consistency
process.body: Deployed designs over multiple Haset events; refined based on feedback and metrics.

outcome: Haset’s visuals now convey leadership, credibility, and community; clearer brand identity helped in promotion, event attendance, and member pride.

title: AAU Homecoming 2024
excerpt: Led the visual identity & merchandise design for Addis Ababa University’s first-ever Alumni Homecoming, bringing together legacy, school pride, and community through wearable and print assets.
alt: AAU Homecoming design mockups on t-shirts, mugs, banners and brochures.
problem: AAU had never before held a comprehensive alumni homecoming event, so there was no existing event brand identity. All merchandise, signage, and printed materials needed a cohesive design that reflected the university’s prestige and resonated with alumni across generations. Materials were varied (t-shirts, mugs, banners, brochures) and needed to feel unified.
solution: Created an event branding system anchored in AAU’s established identity, but refreshed for the homecoming context. Designed graphic motifs and logo lockups specifically for merchandise and signage. Produced designs that could scale across formats and maintain visual impact, whether on fabric or large print banners.
highlights: Merchandise-friendly logo variants (t-shirts, mugs) that maintain clarity in small imprint areas.
Multiple large-format and print pieces (roll-ups, banners, brochures) that use consistent visual language.
A unifying motif or pattern weaving in university heritage elements to evoke pride and nostalgia.
Smooth handover of files and specs for production, ensuring printing quality and color fidelity.
approach: Start with the AAU identity and alumni themes → design event-logo sketches and motif concepts → test mockups across merchandise and print → finalize designs with production constraints in mind (fabric, print process, size) → deliver production assets and guide usage.

process.title: Discovery & Research
process.body: Studied AAU heritage logos, school colors, alumni expectations; attended planning meetings to understand event scope.

process.title: Concept & Sketching
process.body: Created initial logo ideas, patterns, mockups on merchandise and signage, capturing both tradition and vibrancy.

process.title: Design Refinement
process.body: Narrowed down layouts, typography, and motif; tested on sample t-shirt/mug mockups.

process.title: Production & Delivery
process.body: Prepared final files for printing, coordinated with vendors for banners, roll-ups, mugs, t-shirts; ensured quality control.

outcome: A memorable first homecoming with strong visual identity throughout the event. Merchandise was well received; signage and printed materials elevated the brand feel of the event; built a template for future homecomings and alumni events.

Mug design mockup with AAU logo and homecoming motif

title: Britney Social Media
excerpt: Freelance social media design for an international client, creating bold, scroll-stopping visuals tailored for lifestyle content abroad.
alt: Britney social media designs displayed across Instagram feed mockups.
problem: The client needed fresh, engaging social media visuals to stand out in a saturated lifestyle and personal branding space. Previous posts lacked consistency and didn’t align with her evolving online presence.
solution: Delivered a set of modern, on-trend templates optimized for Instagram and Facebook. Balanced bold typography with clean layouts, ensuring brand alignment while resonating with her audience abroad.
highlights: Lifestyle-focused feed templates with consistent tone and color.
Adapted content for different formats - stories, carousels, feed posts.
Introduced reusable design elements to reduce production time.
Balanced international trends with client-specific personality.
approach: Reviewed existing posts and competitor accounts → designed sample mockups → iterated based on feedback through the collaborator → packaged final assets as ready-to-post visuals.

process.title: Discovery
process.body: Gathered brief through collaborator, analyzed client’s existing online presence.

process.title: Exploration
process.body: Designed moodboards referencing international lifestyle brands.

process.title: Refinement
process.body: Finalized palette, typography, and layout patterns; created adaptable templates.

process.title: Delivery
process.body: Packaged assets and provided usage guide for easy adaptation in future posts.

outcome: Delivered an elevated visual presence for the client’s social media channels, resulting in more polished and engaging posts while proving capability to work with international markets.
